ivermectin-can-kill-covid-19-within-48-h.story_title: Ivermectin can kill COVID-19 within 48 hours', Monash University study finds
ivermectin-can-kill-covid-19-within-48-h.summary: Antiviral research conducted by Monash University as led by Dr Kylie Wagstaff has found that a drug named Ivermectin can effectively combat Covid-19 virus in 48 hours.
ivermectin-can-kill-covid-19-within-48-h.what: A drug called Ivermectin is shown to be able to kill the Covid-19 virus in 48 hours
ivermectin-can-kill-covid-19-within-48-h.why: Development of medicine that can treat Covid-19 efficiently is important

challenges-expected-for-novavax-covid-19.story_title: Challenges expected for Novavax' COVID-19 vaccine in USA
challenges-expected-for-novavax-covid-19.summary: US vaccines developer Novavax has developed a vaccine for the Covid-19 pandemic called NVX-CoV2373, which has been tested by 30,000 participants across 119 sites in the US and Mexico. It is shown to be  93% effective. And it will likely be sent to countries who have yet to have a high intake of vaccine. However, it has not been tested against the delta variant. Therefore, there are concerns remained for the vaccine.
challenges-expected-for-novavax-covid-19.what: Novavax has developed a COVID-19 vaccine but there are challenges for it to be uptaken widely
challenges-expected-for-novavax-covid-19.why: Because there is a pandemic whose harmful effect is to be alleviated

australian-gps-urged-to-prescribe-iverme.story_title: Australian GPs urged to prescribe ivermectin triple therapy to fight COVID-19
australian-gps-urged-to-prescribe-iverme.summary: To safe lives that are affected by the Covid-19 virus, Australian GPs are urged to prescribe therapy involving a combination of ivermectin, zinc, and doxycycline to treat patients affected by Covid-19.
australian-gps-urged-to-prescribe-iverme.what: Australian GPs are urged to prescribe triple therapy involving ivermectin to treat patients of COVID-19
australian-gps-urged-to-prescribe-iverme.why: There are many patients suffering from Covid-19 so it is vital to develop and try different treatments

japan-is-first-country-to-approve-covid-.story_title: Japan is first country to approve COVID-19 cocktail Ronapreve
japan-is-first-country-to-approve-covid-.summary: A antibody cocktail drug called Ronapreve, as developed by the Japanese drugmaker Chugai Pharmaceutical owned by Swiss pharma giant Roche, has been approved by the Japanese government to be used to treat patients with mild to moderate COVID-19 via intravenous infusion. The drug has been shown to be effective against multiple variants including the Delta variant in non-clinical studies, and has been approved in other places such as European Union, USA, India, Switzerland and Canada for emergency purpose.
japan-is-first-country-to-approve-covid-.what: Japan is the first country to allow a drug called Ronapreve to be used to treat Covid-19
japan-is-first-country-to-approve-covid-.who: Roche, Regeneron, Japanese government, Chugai Pharmaceutical
japan-is-first-country-to-approve-covid-.why: There is a need to have medicine developed that can treat multiple variant of the Covid-19 virus since the virus may keep on mutating.

pfizer.summary: According to the news six to eights months ago, the Pfizer vaccine has been shown to be one of the three vaccines that are effective against the Delta (Indian) variant of the Covid-19 pandemic. It has been widely approved and applied in countries such as the UK, the US, the EU, and Japan. Not only can the vaccine be applied to adults, some countries also have approved applying the vaccines to adolescences - namely the US (for young people who are 15-16 years old and above) and Canada (for teenagers who are 12-15 years old). Trials concerning the application and effectiveness of the Pfizer vaccine on children (6-12 years old) have been conducted. Yet, no confirmed approval has, according to the news 7 months ago, be given to the usage of the vaccine on children.

astrazeneca.summary: According to new from four to eight months ago, Astrazeneca had been shown as one of the vaccines that could treat the patients affected by the coronavirus. Yet, there had been challenges regarding its global rollout. One of the challenges concerns the stability of supply. For example, India, one of the countries who manufactured the vaccine stopped it's export to other countries when it prioritised domestic use of the vaccine as a result of a surge in cases. The UK, another country which manufactured the vaccine, also had problems meeting its contracted demands from the EU, which led to legal actions taken from the EU against the UK. Another challenge regarding the rollout of the vaccine stemmed from safety concerns. There was news that reported a possibility that the Astrazeneca vaccien gave rise to blood clots. This potential health risk of the vaccine led to a halt to the use of the vaccine in some countries. Finally, despite these challenges, financially, the vaccine had led to an increase in share price and revenue of the company which developed the vaccine.
